lead_paragraph: Donald J. Trump and Hillary Clinton drew a record television audience for their first debate. By comparison, their running mates, Mike Pence and Tim Kaine, may be heavier on policy than on pizazz.

headline.print_headline: After Trump-Clinton Clash, Vice-Presidential Debate Offers Lower Voltage
headline.main: After Trump-Clinton, Vice-Presidential Debate Isn’t Exactly ‘the Return of Elvis’

snippet: Donald J. Trump and Hillary Clinton drew a record television audience for their first debate. By comparison, their running mates, Mike Pence and Tim Kaine, may be heavier on policy than on pizazz....
abstract: Unprecedented spectacle generated by presidential frontrunners overshadows upcoming vice-presidential debate between Republican Mike Pence and Democrat Tim Kaine; experts say encounter between soft-spoken and relatively unknown rivals could provide genuine substance.
